summary: This document is a forwarded email chain from March 10, 2021, requesting FBI agent assistance from the NYPD/FBI Child Exploitation Human Trafficking Task Force for an upcoming review of digital images by Ghislaine Maxwell's defense team at 500 Pearl Street on March 18, 2021.

persons.name: Detective
persons.role: NYPD / FBI Child Exploitation Human Trafficking Task Force Detective
persons.context: The detective sends the initial request for two agents to assist with bringing digital images to 500 Pearl Street for Ghislaine Maxwell's defense review.

persons.name: SSA
persons.role: Supervisory Special Agent, FBI New York Office
persons.context: The SSA forwards the detective's request to other agents, asking those available to contact the detective and copy their respective SSA.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The email references a 'Maxwell request,' indicating the task is related to her legal defense's review of digital evidence.

connections.description: The detective requests assistance from the FBI, and the SSA forwards that request to FBI agents, indicating inter-agency cooperation on the Maxwell case.
The detective is part of the task force investigating Maxwell, as evidenced by the request to assist with her defense's evidence review.

events.title: Defense Review of Digital Images
events.description: Planned all-day event for Ghislaine Maxwell's defense team to review digital images at 500 Pearl Street, requiring two FBI agents to assist with transporting and securing a hard drive.

keyFacts: The NYPD/FBI Child Exploitation Human Trafficking Task Force requested FBI agent assistance for a defense evidence review in the Ghislaine Maxwell case.
The task involved two agents transporting and securing a hard drive containing digital images for Maxwell's defense team to review at 500 Pearl Street.
The evidence review was scheduled for March 18, 2021, and was expected to be an all-day affair.
The email chain demonstrates inter-agency coordination between the NYPD and FBI on the Maxwell investigation in March 2021.
